get.description: Retrieve a member's recovery share, encrypted with that member's share-encryption key.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: Hex encoding of SHA-256 of a member certificate's fingerprint.

post.description: Provide a recovery share for the purpose of completing a service recovery.

parameters.name: memberId
parameters.description: Hex encoding of SHA-256 of a member certificate's fingerprint.

x-ms-ccf-transaction-id.description: Uniquely identifies an atomic transaction within a CCF service. Composed of a term number and sequence number. Sequence numbers increase monotonically, apart from during elections where the service may reuse an existing sequence number. Each election will result in a new, higher term number being used for the conflicting and future sequence numbers.

x-ms-error-code.description: String error code indicating what went wrong.

get.description: Returns all current proposed changes to the service. Note that non-open proposals (ie - those which have already been accepted, rejected, withdrawn, etc) are not returned.

post.description: Submit a proposed change to the service. This will be assigned an ID by the service. Submitting the same signature (including signed COSE headers such as created_at) multiple times will be handled idempotently, returning a single created proposal (or an error if it is no longer available). Any change to the request body will be treated as a new, separate proposal.

x-ms-ccf-transaction-id.description: Uniquely identifies an atomic transaction within a CCF service. Composed of a term number and sequence number. Each election will result in a new, higher term number being used for the conflicting and future sequence numbers.

memberId.description: Identifier for member this stateDigest applies to.

stateDigest.description: Hex-encoding of SHA-256 hash of the root of the service's merkle tree. This should be signed by a new member and submitted as an ACK to mark that member as Active.

Acks.StateDigest.description: A compact summary of the service's state up to a certain point in time, updated and signed by members to indicate their participation in and approval of the service.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

name.description: The name of the action to perform. This should match an action defined in the service's constitution, so that it can be invoked by the `apply` function of the constitution if the proposal is accepted.

args.description: Arguments to modify the behaviour of this action. The schema is determined by the action implementation, and should be validated by a `validate` call in the constitution.

Proposals.Action.description: A single step in a proposed change to the service.

memberId.description: ID of CCF member who signed and submitted this ballot.

ballot.description: The script to execute, returning the voter's support of this proposal.

Proposals.Ballot.description: The source script of an executable vote from a member, regarding a proposed change to the service.

reason.description: Error message describing reason for failure.

trace.description: Callstack showing where failure occurred, if available.

Proposals.FailureInfo.description: Description of why governance execution failed.

Proposals.MemberVotes.description: Each key is a memberId, and the corresponding value is the result of their ballot.

proposalId.description: Unique ID assigned to this proposal at its submission, by the service.

proposerId.description: ID of CCF member who signed and created this proposal.

ballotCount.description: Count of how many ballots have been submitted for this proposal.

finalVotes.description: If a proposal is not open, then this contains the result of each ballot when the proposal transitioned from open.

voteFailures.description: This will be populated with a description of any ballots which failed to execute.

failure.description: If proposalState is Failure, then this will describe why the proposal failed.

Proposals.Proposal.description: Description of a proposed change to the service.

actions.description: A list of actions to apply. Each action is considered, in order, for both proposal and execution of the proposal. All actions are validated and, if the proposal is accepted, applied atomically.

Proposals.ProposalActions.description: The actions contained in a proposal, describing the proposal's changes.

values.name: Open
values.description: Proposal is active and can be voted on.

values.name: Accepted
values.description: Proposal passed a successful vote and was enacted.

values.name: Withdrawn
values.description: Proposal was removed by proposing member. Will never be enacted.

values.name: Rejected
values.description: Proposal was rejected by vote. Will never be enacted.

values.name: Failed
values.description: Proposal passed a successful vote, but its proposed actions failed. Will never be enacted.

values.name: Dropped
values.description: Proposal was open when its semantics were potentially changed (code or constitution were modified), so it was automatically invalidated.

Proposals.VoteFailures.description: Each key is a memberId, and the corresponding value explains why execution of their ballot failed.

memberId.description: ID of CCF member who this recovery share belongs to.

Recovery.EncryptedRecoveryShare.description: A share of a recovery key, granted for a specific recovery member, and encrypted with that member's share-encryption key. This is safe to share in the ledger or amongst untrusted callers, as only the intended member will be able to decrypt and access the secret content.

message.description: Human-readable description of current recovery progress.

submittedCount.description: Count of how many accepted member shares have been submitted, including the current request.

recoveryThreshold.description: Count of how many member shares are required to initiate the end-of-recovery procedure.

Recovery.RecoveryResponse.description: Response to a submitted recovery share.

share.description: Base-64 encoding of a member's raw recovery share (unencrypted).

Recovery.RecoveryShare.description: Container for a member's raw recovery share. This should be carefully guarded, and only submitted to a trusted service over a secure channel, for the purposes of recovery.

consortium.description: Map from memberId to information about each member

ServiceInfo.ConsortiumResponse.description: Describes the members who make up the service's governing consortium.

ServiceInfo.ConstitutionResponse.description: Constitution used to make governance decisions on the service. All governance changes are presented as proposals which must be validated, approved, and applied by the code in this constitution.

Transactions.Transaction.description: Description of a transaction's current state.

Transactions.TransactionStatus.description: Possible states for a CCF transaction. See docs for details: https://microsoft.github.io/CCF/main/use_apps/verify_tx.html#checking-for-commit

memberId.description: Hex encoding of SHA-256 of a member certificate's fingerprint.

proposalId.description: Hex encoding of SHA-256 of proposed actions and merkle root of store at proposal creation. Unlike other IDs, this is generated on the service and will not be known in advance.

transactionId.description: Uniquely identifies an atomic transaction within a CCF service. Composed of a term number and sequence number. Sequence numbers increase monotonically, apart from during elections where the service may reuse an existing sequence number. Each election will result in a new, higher term number being used for the conflicting and future sequence numbers.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.

CoseSignature.body.name: body
CoseSignature.body.description: A raw CoseSign1 signature. See CCF docs for required headers and body schema: https://microsoft.github.io/CCF/main/use_apps/issue_commands.html#cose-sign1
